review: For a place that specializes in Burgers. Mine has always been average. Usually overcooked even though I ask for medium. Fries are okay. It's average and service can be slow. I have tried about 3-4 Burgers. Blue cheese, Spicy, Hawaiian, Mexican/Guacamole one. All were tasty, but the meat is always average at best.

This is my first review typed in FOREVER. So I might as well get the steam rolling now and end with the good ones. So last night on October 17th, 2012 my boyfriend and I went to Red Robin for some dinner after my shift ended at 8pm. We entered and we're greeted within 5 minutes. This meaning the hostess was at the edge of the bar folding stuff and I assume (yes that makes an ass of you and me) she didn't want to use her side vision...however she did apologize so that is a great thing! She seated us and told us our server is Taylor. I KNEW WE SHOULD HAVE SAT AT THE BAR .....simply because I think the service would have been outstanding. We each ordered alcohol and water...when we got our water Taylor said he would be back with our drinks....then our appetizers came! Nothing yummier than HOT & FRESH Mozzarella sticks and onion rings....WITHOUT SILVERWARE. Halfway through our apps...we got our drinks. Now doesn't your drink usually come with your water?! Our food was great and was not a problem.  The main things that bothered me were: 1) Umm what happened to "EXCUSE ME'...as I started to grab my yummy wrap I noticed an arm inches from my nose and a pitcher attached to that arm pouring water. What ever happened to "Excuse me for reaching over you OR Would you hand me your glass so I can fill it? Usually I am good about handing the glass but I did not see the water pitcher or notice his reach right away. RUDE! 2) I'm used to a midori sour in a short wide glass with little ice. This glass (which I should have taken a picture of) was half the size of a graphing calculator, loaded with ice, and cost me.....$5.29. Dear lordy lordy I basically had a shot of midori sour. 3) Just the overall customer service was not exciting. The worst server I have had there ever. I grew up in Oregon and was gone for 4 years. Came back in May and been to this Red Robin 4 times now and this time was THE WORST.  Never checked on our food, reached over my food to poor a water glass at the other end of the table, and the drink was dinky! Of course....I'll be back...I'll just choose my waiter! The area I hate to sit in (the booths by the bathroom) will be my new spot because those girls and manager know how to provide service!

Normally, chain restaurants like RR are not high on my priority list of restaurants, but my co-workers got me to sign up for their birthday club - to get a free birthday burger.  Not that chains don't have good food; but you've been to one RR, you've been to them all. I like originality. However; there's no disputing they make a really, good burger!  Having gotten my free birthday burger email, I decided to use it today after church and split it with my mom. Then my brother decided to tag along. So much for walking out of there without spending a penny (besides tip).  When I arrived, my mom had already been seated. She gushed about how sweet the  waiter was; having brought her a refill of soda without her asking (must be bottomless like the fries??) When our server, Taylor, greeted us, I explained that we were there for my free burger. Instead of giving that surly look some servers give (my guess is they're questioning whether you know to tip on on the entire bill before the discount), Taylor smiled and was all "Sure! Great. No prob. What can I get for ya?"  Without asking he then brought us our burger, split in half. The cook also divvied up our sweet potato fries. Taylor asked how we liked the meat cooked and like a good server, he took note that we wanted it well done. The chef then followed orders and cooked it well (so often they do not and my meat comes out bloody). The Bleu Ribbon Burger my mom and I split was to die for! I knew I couldn't go wrong when I read the description ("Basted with a tangy steak sauce, topped with crumbled Bleu cheese and crispy onion straws, lettuce, fresh tomatoes and zesty chipotle aioli on an onion bun) and every bite melted in my mouth.  My brother and I got into an argument, so Taylor diffused it with more of each kind of fry (I didn't think we'd asked but it shut us up).  Yes. Not only did we tip on what would be the whole bill, but we gave Taylor 20%. If only every server were the genuinely nice! (I've had mediocre service at RR before, so Taylor brought their 3 star rating up to a 4) I'll be back for sure. This time next year. ha ha

I don't go to Red Robin that often, but when I do I always have the crispy chicken sandwich. Everything is fresh and always tastes good. They have a really good variety of foods and who can resist their mud pie. I like that on their menu now you can substitute a salad or fruit for french fries or add something to your order for not very much money. I usually go to the Clackamas location and have never had a problem. Red Robin isn't my first choice, but I am never really disappointed when I do go there.
I know this is a chain restaurant but they are pretty consistent in what they serve you. If you have a problem they will take care of it no questions asked. Plus they usually have a monthly special.
Good french dip.  Ajus could have been a little more flavorful but otherwise a good choice.

Red Robin To Go is my summer go to so far this year. $10 salads that cover lunch and dinner, don't require me to turn on my oven, allow me to read my book with a glass of water at the bar and the possibility to call ahead (yeah, right, I'm not a planner that way). I'm a big fan of this chain for more-than-a-drivethru-experience meals.  Literally every time I've been in, someone else has To Go for a tavern burger. I don't know what that is but people love it.  I love their salads and wraps. Their Avocobbo salad has avocado, bacon, bleu cheese, olives, tomatoes, hard boiled egg and your choice of dressing with a slice of foccacia. Their honey mustard is better than anywhere else's I've tried.  It can definitely get expensive if you order drinks while you wait, I would steer clear of that. Otherwise, your ten dollar salad becomes a $40 night on the town.  Bonus for awesome parking!

I always come here for milkshakes and love them!! I have had some bad restaurant experiences at other places and whenever I would try and talk with a manager on anything, no one ever gets back to me, it gets put off and then I just say forget about it. One night I had a small problem here and decided to go ahead and send in feedback just to let the restaurant know. Jim the manager was VERY PROMPT at getting back to me on my review. He had called me after 5 and I was driving home, he asked if 3 the next day would work and I said yes. Sure enough he called me right at 3 the following day, we discussed what happened and I was glad to notice he actually listened to me. This is great customer service to me, as I've been in situations where some people really didn't care if there was a problem. Thanks Jim, I will always come back here for my milkshakes!!!

Very disappointed. Visited this location on Saturday evening around 6:30. Sat at the bar due to too long of a wait for a regular table. One bartender, Kristina, for the entire restaurant (first mistake). Lost our appetizer order (second mistake), onion rings did not arrive until after our burgers and after we complained about not receiving them. Waited 45 minutes for 2 burgers. My burger, which was a Burning love with chicken and sweet potato fries, came out, cold and completely soggy. Almost as if it was a mistake from another order that had been sitting in the window for two long. Even the fried jalapenos, which make the burger, were a soggy mushy mess. I ate the chicken out of one half of the sandwich and left the rest. The bartender asked me if I would like a togo box to take the rest home and I told her, no the sandwich was completely soggy and I couldn't eat it. At which  she said she was sorry and proceeded to get our check without even seeing if we wanted another beer or dessert. It was handled very poorly and after the mess up with our appetizer I didn't want to be "that" customer who does nothing but complain. But when you get terrible food and not so good service someone needs to know about to so that maybe it doesn't happen to someone else. I hope that this review will help them to make some changes to their procedures. But at this point, I have no desire to ever return to this restaurant.
Had a great experience.  The food was good, as usual. We were the first customers on a Sunday morning so everything was quick and ready to go.   Our server,  Colton, was awesome.

Our appetizer of pretzel bites with cheese were like trying to bite a tiny rock in half, second try wasn't any better. The croissant that my sandwich came on was stale and dry. The batter on the shrimp and chicken was burnt on some pieces and under done on others.  Our waitress was friendly but other than bringing a new order of pretzel bites nothing was done to try and fix the poor food quality.  Maybe if we try Red Robin again we will have better luck.

The food is pretty much consistent here, in a good way, but there is always a long wait. I understand that a place like this can get busy and form a waiting list, but I have waited here numerous times when there are empty tables ready for people to sit at. Also, service can be slow at times. Maybe they just need more employees, I am not really sure.
The food was good, typical red robin. I always love their BBQ chicken wrap and of course the strawberry lemonade! Service was good. Had a very friendly girl seat us. I'd go back!

What happened to Clackamas. I grew up coming to this Red Robin all the time, and I remember the servers being super nice, and the atmosphere in general being very welcoming. My family came here for dinner, and from the moment we walked in, I felt like we were in a completely different area. Once we were seated, our server paid no attention to us. Further, the place was not busy, ad when we asked for a basket of fries, her response: "I can't guarantee it since we're very busy right now." For one, who says that? Isn't red robin known for bottomless steak fries? If your establishment is built upon that motto, you better live up to it. Secondly, I took one look around the entire restaurant and I can count many empty tables, so clearly this server did not have a sense of her surroundings.  Once our food came out, it was fine, but I had lost my appetite due to the poor attitude of the server. As we were leaving, and putting on our coats, another waitress said, "please move along" while using jan motions pushing us. Wtf?! I was about to give her a piece of my mind.  I don't know what happened here, but this place has just gone down hill like there's no end. The servers act like they are from the trailer parks, and have no proper training in customer service. It's sad that the happy valley area has gotten so ghetto. I blame it on the MAX train system coming in, but that's still no excuse for service at a restaurant to be sub-par. I hope the managers of the Clackamas Red Robin train their staff in proper service and etiquette.

Red Robin Gourmet Burgers is by far one of the best. No matter what is ordered from the menu, one can expect, YUM.  Cant go wrong with a classic crispy chicken burger or fish n chips. I probably receive exceptional service simply cause I know a waitress.  Had a craving for fish n chips one day after work. Simply phoned it in and was ready by the time reaching Red Robin in Clackamas. Not too picky when it comes to food but I know what I like when I taste it. This place gets my YUM award.

Valentine's day, the Server was so nice! Everything was hot when it came out. Mozzarella cheese sticks and onion rings to start. Hot and delicious! I hadn't really liked onion rings before tonight, and these were great. (Can't eat too many tho) Then, We both decided on the bacon cheeseburger, but I wanted mine on the chaibatta bread. (sry spell check needed! Lol). The burger was hot and juicy, bacon was crunchy and lettuce was crisp. But I was disappointed in the bread I chose. I thought it would come toasted (ya Kno like in the pictures of the burgers), so I didn't ask for it to be toasted. I think it would have been soooo much better if the bread was toasted. The strawberry lemonade has real strawberries! And not the fake syrup stuff that makes your throat close up while the trying to drink it and breath! (Like Wendy's! Lol) We have been here before and will come occasionally, but it was great service and food. We will continue to return as long as everything stays great!

Looks like they have a new menu. They still has the same classics and their bottomless fries...but to my delight I noticed they have bottomless sweet potato fries! Also the kids mac and cheese is awesome.
Your typical run of the mill chain restaurant burgers. Enough said. Lots of better local burger places in town.

My husband and I attempted a date night. We were going to kick it off with dinner at Red Robin. 5:30 on a Thursday night and there was no parking in the lot shared with a neighboring restaurant. So we went to the adjacent empty lot, and proceeded to be scolded by the 80 year old security guard. Thanks for making date night a failure because you couldn't invest in more parking.

When seated the seats were dirty and the table was wet.  The hamburgers were disappointing for what you paid. We had to ask for everything we needed and it was not very busy.  Other Red Robins have been good but there must be something about this one that just doesn't seem to cut it.

With the way the food prices here keep going up and the size and quality of the burgers keeps going down and/or getting smaller I will no longer eat at Red Robin restaurants.The new burgers now start at about $11. and go up to over $14. Next they will be eliminating the original burgers that are $9. to $10. And yes, I've noticed the last couple of times eating there that not only the long time burgers are getting smaller but also the new $11. plus burgers are not any larger that the less expensive burgers. So Red Robin I'm done, there are other great burger places that I can at least get a full stomach and a great burger for a lot less than $11. to $14. I will post a picture of the minuscule $14. burger.

This used to be my favorite place to get a burger. USED to be. Over the past few years the quality of the burgers have just gotten worse and worse. Mine has come to me cold and dry and the condiments are soggy and the burger just makes my stomach upset afterwards. I still like the fries, however their quality has gone down too. Some are soggy and the potato tastes awful, and then some are crispy and good. I always regret eating there, and so I think I will spend my money on a better burger elsewhere.

A great place for lunch! I like the food here a lot. Not just burgers but fish, chicken and other great choices.  Today I had the clam chowder along with the seafood scatter. So good.  I like the Clackamas location not just for the food. I look forward to sitting in the bar area and having Kristina as my server. She is very nice to her customers and very attentive.  Red Robin YUMMmmmmmm...

I recommend the chicken wrap with BBQ sauce! Really good. Especially with the bottomless fries (if u get the right waiter who will give them to you). Service is a crapshoot depends who is working. Can be great,  can be bad. Food is always good American fare. Burgers are good too of course. Stay away from the arctic cod sandwich ... Very dry. Food is always good consistently, except for that cod sandwich.

Best milkshakes ever! I went here yesterday with my boyfriend for a quick lunch after seeing a movie, even though I wasn't really hungry. We ended up getting just the steak fries, a milkshake for each of us and he also had a strawberry lemonade. Personally, I prefer my lemonades (whether it's plain, or has fruit) more lemony tasting than sweet, but he loved it! He got a little mad when I insulted his fries, though. xD I honestly don't see what the hype is with the fries. Sure, they're thick and the sauce we got was pretty good, but they're too soft for me. I like my fries a little crispy on the outside. There was this seasoning bottle he put on them, and for me it was too salty, but it was still okay. I wanted to grind pepper on them, but he wouldn't let me. Anyways, the milkshakes were thick, creamy and "Oh my god, this is amazing!" I literally had a mouthgasm. I recommend getting one next time your around a Red Robin. Plus, the wait wasn't too long either. Less than 10 minutes!

Yummmmm... Still one of our favorite places. they also have the best gluten free / dairy fee burger. I do the Whisky River Bbq Burger, no cheese, gluten free bun, and sauteed onions instead of onion straws. Awesome!!

Red robin has great food . The wait time to be seated was fast we came here at dinner time . We were seated within 10 mins . Our server was fast with taking our order . We ordered the smoke and pepper burgers they were perfect! I would recommend red robin and will come back here again !

every time this place is amazing...  the royal burger is the best and has everything on it...  when we got there i was very very hungry.  they were so nice they brought out some fries early so i didnt eat my napkin!!!

Getting better, give it a try!!!! I decided to give Red Robin another try after my last review.  They were quick to message me and get more information which I appreciated, and I was able to speak with management which showed their concern and care for their customers.  That goes a long way with this reviewer. I went back with my parents a few nights ago on a Saturday night.  I was very surprised to see the complete remodel.  It looks fantastic.  They've painted, and re-configured their walk in and waiting area, making it customer focused and much quieter.  I never cared for the kids room with games and loud noise. It was busy as expected, and we waited about 15 minutes, which was more than fine with me at dinner time on a busy weekend.  I especially appreciated the young man at the check in keeping an eye out for an empty booth in the bar area, and when one opened they called us over.   Food was very good, and a much better improvement since my last visit.  Service was spot on and very friendly as well.  I ordered my usual veggie burger and we all split an onion ring appetizer which was really nice.  I assumed we'd be waiting a bit for food, but they were able to get things out in plenty of time, and our food was hot. Only negative here was that I had ordered cheese on my burger and didn't come with any.  I knew this was an extra charge which is the norm these days so I brought it to the attention of our waitress.  She apologized and quickly offered to remove the charge from the bill.  I would have appreciated it slightly more if there was an offer to remake my burger, but it wasn't too important so I didn't sweat it.  People get way too upset about little things like that anyway. Red Robin seems to have come a long way in recent months.  Perhaps the expediting could still be a bit better and has a few kinks to work out, but those things are just going to happen in a busy restaurant from time to time. Overall, I'm pleased to see some changes here and I'll be happy to return.  Check this place out and their great new remodel, you'll be pleasantly surprised!!!

Omg this place was a big disappointment. Love the one in Gresham. This one has horrible design for seating its sooo noisey its ridiculous cant even hear yourself think. Service was slow and i mean slow took 15 mins to get soda after asked. Was seated next to a bunch of kids like literally next to. Sat us on a long bench them 10 .ins later sat a group with a kid that literally jumped on me to get to his seat. Like really disgusted with this place.

Now, I'm a diehard Red Robin fan.  I know what I'm going to get each time, and each time it's sinfully delicious.  This review is based on service.  When I met my friend here one night, we were placed at a two top right near the kitchen.  Not an issue, except that we rarely saw our server.  It took 20m to get our drink order, and by then I was so Hangry (Angry Hungry) I just ordered.  Off our sticky menus.  Ick.   My final gripe has nothing to do with RR directly.  The parking is ALWAYS atrocious.  Thankfully, the Chevy's next door closed, because typically I didn't even try their lot, but would trek over to Target's lot and play a real life-and-death version of frogger while running across the street to the restaurant.  This time, I circled several times before I gave up.  Thankfully my friend found a spot and shuttle bussed me back to my car.

Awful!  Was told 45 minute wait for our party of 14 and we are still waiting...1 hour and 20 minutes.  Manager came and talked to is and basically said, that's life.  We have watched SO many parties that came in WAY after us be seated.  Obviously they are not running things well.  Nothing was offered to us to compensate us for the ridiculous wait!  Completely unacceptable with half out party being kids!  Don't come here if you have more than 4 people! UPDATE:  Manager came and said appetizers will be waiting for us...something at least!  Servers were awesome and helpful after our super long wait so that makes up for it a bit!  Thanks wait staff!  They salvaged the bad situation and turned it into something good!

Everyone complained about their parking but we just pulled right into a parking space right at the entrance at 6pm during the holidays.  It wasn't until we walked out to the car when we realized we parked in the "to-go" parking space.  If we didn't know, we're not guilty!  Beside from that, our expedience was surprisingly pleasant.  We avoid chain restaurants because we just don't enjoy the food as much.  Burger was good,  price was more than fair for a fresh burger compared to how expensive you pay for fast food these days.  This is definitely a group/setting.  Tons of birthday celebrations so it's loud.

Went to the Clackamas Red Robin to celebrate my birthday on a Friday night.   It was 6:30 and it was a 1/2 hour wait, once we got seated it was another  20 minutes before being waited on.  We ordered margaritas  which waiter kept saying they would be up shortly  and another 20 minutes. . No water, napkins or silverware  in the meantime,  then when our food did arrive  the fries were cold and the bugers warm not "hot". We had let waiter know it was my birthday  and still forgot at end of our meal, reminded him again about the birthday sundae which was delivered.  End of dinner the bill  came and to our surprise we were charged $1.99 for it.  The restaurant has many upgrades  and pretty, but service and food rated less than 1 star. We will not return.. sad :(

Went there with my family of 6 on a Sunday night. 30 minute wait but that is the usual with them they are always busy, and that was not a problem. 20 minutes after we ordered we were informed that our server or the kitchen not sure which lost our ticket and we had to place our order again and wait another 30 minutes to get our food.  Our server was apologetic and offered to have the manager come by but he never showed. I was a little disappointed that I wasn't offered fry sauce with my meal. We weren't checked on during our meal to get fry or beverage refills either.  It was my husband's birthday and to our children's disappointment we were in no mood to even mention to our server it was his bday.  The bill came and we were expecting some sort of discount for our one hour wait but there was none. We arrived at 6:00 and we left at 8:13..thank god for smart phones I don't know how much longer I could have entertained 4 children without one..  Next time we will go to the ram across the street. Red Robin is no longer my family's birthday dinner spot.

This R. R. has a new classy look to the restaurant. Still the same menu, the same employees, the same everything! Our waitress was cool. She did almost spill ranch dressing on my girlfriend but my girl has cat like reflexes and was able to get out of the way of the ranch shower before it got all over her. As is my framily. We can't go places without one of us causing a scene.  Hence the "Ranchower".   (lol. I kill me!) Our apps were great. Had the mozzarella sticks and the leaning tower of Onion Rings, good golly there was a ton! My BFF R. G. is a gluten free Girl. We asked for a G. F. Menu that took a few moment's to get and then when R. G. asked about Gluten in an item our waitress was unsure if it had Gluten. WE suggested she find out. Did you read that? "We suggested she find out".  When it comes to peoples allergies how bout you figure out your job and help us as customers. We did get our answers and my friend was happy.    Then our burgers came out. We almost had it all  when the person who ordered a Ghost Pepper burger got a regular cheeseburger instead. That was just dumb. How you could mix up a regular cheeseburger with a burger that has ghost pepper aioli, fresh jalapenos, pickled jalapenos and pepper jack cheese on it, is beyond me. 1 has cheese and 1 is covered in fire. Figure it out!  All in all it was good. We like burgers and the menu is ok.

I got the free burger for my birthday so we went there for dinner last week.  The restaurant was remodeled from the last time I was there so it was a nice change.  We had to wait a few minutes before we got the table.  When we ordered our food,  we were told by the waitress that the kitchen was backed up and we might have to wait for a while before we can get our food. Finally the burgers arrived.  Mine was great,  along with the fries and all those fancy dipping sauces.  I love their new dipping sauces for the fries.  It is a nice change from the normal ketchup and ranch dressing. Overall it was a great dinner and I was overstuffed with burger that I don't think I can eat another burger for a while.  The waitress was super nice and friendly. This is a good place to come back whenever I have a yearning for a big juicy burger.

Okay, I was here a few months ago, the service was crappy but the food was good. Our waitress Jamie was a doll and provided excellent service and was prompt, and greeted us with a genuine smile (not like those fake smiles people often give). Our food arrived in a timely manner. I ordered a Guacamole Bacon Burger, but to my great disappointment, they forgot to put Guacamole on it... yeah, the Guacamole was forgotten. How does one forget the Guacamole on a Guacamole Bacon Burger you might ask? I'm still trying to figure this one out.
I could seriously eat there every day! Always great service and always great food. The problems are with the lack of parking and there is usually always a wait.

If I could give this place zero stars, I would. Yesterday's experience was the most humiliating, mortifying experience I have ever had in a public place. It was my 25th birthday, and my 60 year old parents and I sat in the bar for lunch. I handed the waitress my DMV issued temporary drivers license and expired drivers license for photo ID (I had to renew), and she immediately went to speak with the manager. When she came back, she said the manager refused my ID. I asked to speak with him, and when he came out, he said that he was not trained to accept that form of ID, and I would not be allowed to order alcohol in his restaurant. The ID I presented was just as legal as any other form of ID they had been presented by other patrons at the restaurant. After explaining to him that my ID was issued by the state, and is a legal form of identification, and offering other forms of legal ID, he refused and rudely asked me, "What do you want?!". I responded that I wanted my food and the birthday mai tai that I was legally allowed to have, and he snapped that he would just get me my drink so I would stop. I thanked him, but maybe 5 minutes later, he returned and said that nobody in that establishment would be serving me a drink or would accept my driver's license as they were afraid they would lose their liquor license. You can't lose your liquor license by following the law. You can't lose a food handler card by following the law. When I told the manager that this is what the DMV issues as a temporary ID, he argued with me and treated me like a criminal at my birthday lunch with my parents, in front of dozens of people. I told him that the next time someone comes in with the form of ID that I had, I could only hope he treated them less like a jerk. He loudly, and rudely, claimed that he couldn't and WOULDN'T read my driver's license. I pointed to where my "Under 21 until...", "DOB..", and "Name..." were, and he wouldn't even look at it. He could read it, he could see that I was of age, he just decided that it was his day to treat someone  worse than the rags they use to wipe down their tables. He looked at me as if I was a punk criminal trying to get away with underage drinking. I had been to a wedding the night before, and the staff had no issues reading it when I ordered a glass of wine. I was so humiliated by the manager that I left with tears in my eyes and everyone staring at me as if I was the bad guy. I cannot, in good conscience, promote that kind of treatment, and I will not be visiting that establishment or any other RR location.

We decided to go to Red Robin after about five years of absence. We were feeling the "cool" burger experience with a full bar and fun ambiance. Ten years ago Red Robin was known for its fun great food, burgers cooked to order and general casual awesomeness. I do not know what happened to this Red Robin aside of the fact that they have been through the full bloom of a now heavily built up area. With the Clackamas mall, trendy new restaurants and high concentration of shopping traffic this Red Robin died inside. Our time there was pretty bad. It was really bad actually. It was enough for me to email the company in distress which I usually avoid. It broke my heart to pay for our meal. Only two members of my party ate some of their food and they were very unhappy with it. The rest of the food was taken away at the end of the meal with one bite taken and a server who did not ask us why.  We ordered the appetizers of Fried Zucchini and fried fresh Jalapenos. Why? The Zucchini was not mushy or oily, it was still to the bite and fresh tasting. I will give them that. The batter itself was overcooked and greasy. They mixed the two appetizers together creating a glob of fried jalapenos and zucchini. Two or three bites in and we were done. A drink order of Crown Royal Whiskey on the rocks tasted like a hard candy. The glass was unwashed and still had the residue of whatever fruity cocktail had once been in it. This is unforgivable. We asked the server if perhaps they had accidentally served us a flavored whiskey but were informed they did not carry any flavored whiskey. It was simply a unwashed glass.  The burgers that we ordered, we all ordered "as rare as you can do them". We know that most restaurants have to cook to a certain temperature for health regulation reasons. Red Robin in the past has always been able to provide some good tasting beef at medium rare while staying within those guidelines. They cremated our burgers. I have to admit that I was shocked almost to tears at my over ten dollar burger which came without most of the listed toppings and was burnt. It was a deep grey color on the inside. I could not eat more than one bite. I had the Prime Chophouse. I dislike McDonald's burgers, but even theirs would taste better. I will never go back to this location. We were ignored by our server. Our meal was not good. My heart broke for a use-to-be great restaurant.
I really enjoy going to "RED ROBIN" they have great service, and are very warm and inviting.

Red robin I'm sorry you used to be good. And now you're bottomless fries are skeletons like you almost have to wait an hour for another round. You have added way to many food items to the menu which can be a peeling but if all are just sub par then who cares . You used to do good burgers and sandwiches. Now it seems nothing more then a over priced fast food chain.

Just went here today. As far as chain restaurants go, this one is less annoying. Always tasty food, love the options they give for vegetarians. This is our default place when we just want a burger (and some air conditioning). I've had a few different drinks and appetizers here, and everything lives up to it's hype on the menu.
We've been here a couple times, it's a good place to eat if you want a gourmet burger.  I try to couple different burgers and do like their onion rings....

We come here often, at least twice a month. Never have we had service as bad as today. We ordered the Bonzai boneless wings and she brought out their buzzard wings, we asked for the correct ones and she brought out wings with BBQ sauce on them and then she finally realized she again brought out the wrong one and brought us the correct appetizer. At the same time the correct appetizer was brought out we ordered our entrees.. An hour later our food is brought out and it's obviously been sitting a while. My BBQ chicken wrap has soggy lettuce that just disintegrated in my mouth. The top was crispy as it had obviously been sitting under the heat lamp a while. My sons Mac n cheese was HOT on top and cold in the middle. Our drinks were empty and we had to flag our waitress down for refills. Basically, the food is USUALLY amazing, but don't sit in Arie's section. ** Update- I wrote this while still waiting for my second round of food to show up, the waitress ended up taking off my entree from the bill and as we walked out the manager offered us a $15 gift card. It doesn't make up for the terrible service/experience but at least they realized that something went wrong.**

This store in particular seems to be in a decline ever since the remodel a few months ago. They seem to be to operating with not enough staff (long wait times despite empty tables, food taking a long time to come out, ect.) and the restaurant is dirty (sticky tables, menus, tables not bussed, ect.).  Last night, we waited about 20 minutes to be seated and when we got a table we waited nearly 20 more minutes to place an order. The waiter in the area went to every table around us but ignored ours. We finally left without getting service because we couldn't wait any longer. It should be noted that there were empty tables all around us so they weren't slammed.  They also are now saying they won't bring fries out ahead of time while you wait for your burger due to a new "corporate policy."  Yet they will still give you bottomless fries when your meal does come out. Makes sense to make your customers wait without anything to eat, especially when ticket times have been increasing.  It's disappointing because this restaurant used to be a go-to spot for our family for a good meal.

Writing a review of a big chain like Red Robin seems pointless as they will never reach a 5 star average and most know that their expectations should be lowered because it is a big chain restaurant.  It misses the local flavor and folksiness.  At any rate here's my review - - Haven't been to RR in a looong time but decided to go for my birthday as I had a free Birthday Burger waiting for me, and I really like free.  I went with my 11 year old son...because I really really likes free.  Well, I guess the old adage "you get what you pay for" is true.  I had the Burnin Love burger and the boy got Clucks and Shrimp.  The food was subpar at best.  The burger was a soggy mess and tasted sort of ok.  The bottomless Strawberry Lemonade was good but mine certainly had a bottom as the second one I asked for never arrived.  I asked for some milk as I knew my Burnin Love burger was going to be painful later, and milk does an amazing job of taming the savage beast.  When it finally arrived, it was warm and un-needed.  The server started out good but proved to be rather inattentive and her tip reflected my opinion of her service.

What's red robin all about you might ask? Welp it's all about American burgers and bottomless fries.... Or so we thought.... This is a restaurant I grew up going to and have watched it changed. I feel that they are trying to get away from the classic American styles and going towards the fancy downfall.  They remodeled here and it's like they took out some seats. This red robin is busier than ever. Be prepared to wait and wait and wait to get a seat.  Food is red robin food but it's hard now to just get bottomless fries before you order! If you have time to waste? This is your spot. Patience is required here!!

I've been coming here for years and it's still one of my favorite chain restaurants! Great food, easily customizable, and my favorite- UNLIMITED SWEET POTATO FRIES! We love coming here when we're trying to stick to a gluten-free diet because they do a wonderful lettuce wrap of any burger/chicken sandwich you want! I've never had to wait, or if there's a line to check in we go sit in the bar where there's free-for-all seating! They recently took away happy hour but also lowered some of their pricing so it all evens out!

Yikes. I don't know what I was thinking eating here, but I have had decent food at other Red Robins. Being in the middle of the food wasteland that is Clackamas, this seemed like a safe bet. It was a debacle. Cold fries, gross mac n cheese (you know it's bad when the kids can't even eat that) and a half thrown together salad with overcooked chicken. No thanks!

I read the other reviews and got a little nervous about go here last night. But I do love Red Robin and I got a notification that their newest burger called the Uber Burger was out. I usually frequent the Eugene location but I was in Portland on business. We got there at 6:30 and were told there would be a wait of about 10 or 15 minutes. We had the option of the bar which had a huge booth (there was only two of us) they encouraged us to sit at. The area was cozy and comfortable. I asked for the Uber Burger with a Sam Adams Octoberfest. They said they were not going to start selling the burger until Monday. My wife asked if the server would ask and see if they would cook one up for me. The answer was yes, and that's good customer service. The burger was amazing and the fries were so fresh I had to blow on them before I ate them. Good Ol Red Robin.

EVERYTIME we have come here something gets messed up. Today they put in the wrong order for my husband and they gave me the wrong side. I'm not sure why I subject myself to this anymore.  Update: if I could seriously give them negative stars I would. Today's visit was excruciating awful. First off, with Chevys being closed and a new restaurant under construction, what ever company is doing the work has decided to take out about a third of the parking spots, in an already crappy parking lot, we ended up parking across the street (not a big deal). We went there as a party of 5 + 1 child and got seated in about 30 minutes , 10 mins from what we were told the wait was. We got seated and 10 minutes later, the waitress came to get our drink orders, we decided that we were ready to order at that point. 30-35 minutes later, we got our food. We had also ordered an appetizer of onion rings which didn't come until the rest of the food got there. The food was mediocre at best. All of the food temperature was on the verge of being cold, not sure how long it was sitting in the window before it was picked up by the server but it was bad. My burger had a hardened bun and when I sent it back to get redone, it came back missing an ingredient (bacon). I do not know what happened to this place but it is in a sad state of affairs.  Note: when I sent my burger back, I expected to talk to a manager.....not so. I will be writing to corporate as it was extremely disappointing.

smaller portions - increasing prices - terrible remodel -- nice job destroying 40 yrs of history... never fun to wait 30 min to get a table and then wait another 30 min to get cold food unhappy understaffed restaurant with staff and managers looking like they are hating life corporate must be drinking the steve carley kool-aid  will go to killer burger next time

This restaurant is so hit and miss regarding food it's almost laughable. One day my food will be hot and delicious, then the very next day it will be cold and delivered to me wrong. So many ups and downs it's hard to call this a consistent, good restaurant. The staff is hit and miss too.

Classy chest tattoos, bad hygiene & cigarette perfume sums up the servers here. Customer service was the worst of any place we've ever been. They don't offer fries while you wait anymore, when they do come, they are frozen. I sent them back. Don't go, any place in the area will be better!  Literal crap.

Gotta love Red Robin. This one has been here for a while and they've always been good with their unlimited fries and cheap burgers.  Where else can you go and get a good sized cheeseburger and unlimited fries for only 6.99? Inside is pretty big and they've got the new computer things at every table where you can play games or pay your bill.  Overall the price is right and the food is good. I recommend!

Not impressed, unbelievable that there is a line. Not much better than BK. :( When a menu is mainly  based on burgers I expect at that price to be seasoned and cooked to the requested temp. The buzzard sauce for fries was a pile of grease on hot sauce. Unbelievable people look forward to eating here.

We were just ignored at another restaurant and left that place when we decided to come here instead. It was a good choice, because we were greeted and sat as soon as we walked in, and although it seemed a bit busy, we were greeted by someone at our table in no time. The service was great! The atmosphere was clean and looked brand new. Everything looked pretty whimsical and modern. They have changed up their menu since the last time I went to a Red Robin, but what hasn't changed is the bottomless fries. Woo! Hoo! We only got an extra basket, because we were so stuffed, and we definitely used their seasoning, because it's awesome. We ordered a Burnin' Love with chicken instead of a burger patty. It was the perfect amount of spicy with chipotle sauce and pepper jack cheese. It was yummy. My child got the fish and chips, and for fish and chips at Red Robin, they were good and crispy. We ordered chips with guacamole and salsa beforehand as an appetizer, and they were simple, but they weren't completely filling like most appetizers.  When we left, we got a red Red Robin balloon, which my child loved and wouldn't let go of for the rest of the day.

Debates on 2 or 3 stars because food was good . However the the restaurant was filthy . The booth, the carpet, the kitchen (yuck) saw it as we exited. $3 for each iced tea? Ridiculous. Won't be returning . I wanted to update how ridiculous this has become after providing Red Robin with feedback about this 9880 SE Washington St. Portland OR location. I have received 3 emails asking for the same information I'd already given! Each time they have the wrong store location listed and each time I correct them. It's obvious that I or my family & friends will no longer be patronizing such a place

Waitress didn't know what came on my burger so I didn't receive what I actually wanted.  Service was slow, and she didn't give me back the correct change thus shorting me money. I wrote a review on the website and asked for a reply via email from the manager and I have yet to receive one 3+ months later.

In town on a very wet Halloween. Wanted something local, but familiar. Read all the reviews, but decided to go anyway. Not sure why, but the place is scruffy. Not quite dirty, but the carpet could have used vacuuming. This was 8pm and it looked like it had not been revacuumed since opening. Servers doing the bus person role. ?? No cleaning staff? ? Service casual. Seemed as if the touchscreen remote on the table was intended to act as interface, but incomplete menu and beer options. Set up to summon a server rather than have the server be primarily responsible for the customers. Technology poorly designed and implemented.  Mixed review on the food: one burger good, other dry with over caramelized onions that tasted as if they were cooked hours earlier. Bottom line : something fundamental has gone wrong with the chain. Off the list- even in the pouring rain!

Went to this location on October 21st and after sitting there and not getting recognized for a good ten minutes - even after turning on the 'call waitress' button- we walked out. On our way out, the host said have a good day. We looked at him in shock and told him we couldn't even get waited on. He had no response. The restaurant was not all that busy at the time. We were seated in the bar area. Many employees were busy around us but none alerted anyone about our flashing call light. Just looked at it and kept going. Notified the company, got their standard response letter and that was it. We have been pretty regular customers here and the service has never been great but never this bad.

Im over it! Now that you guys have new owners you guys constantly screw up and dont value customers, especially returning customers....you got rid of perfectly great staff who valued customers for a bunch of people who could care less... the food has also changed on your menu and its a little too pretentious for us.. i know we are just 2 people in a sea of Red Robin lovers but i believe with your poor customer service, and now lousy food, plenty of people will follow..

Today tried their new limited Mad Love Burger. I expected more to be honest... But I am full from the burger. If it tasted a bit better I would had finished it.  It also took a very long time for them to take the order and make it (as usual). By the time I got my burger the cheese was completely dried out... Which was kinda difficult to eat lol.

Great burgers and can't go wrong with bottomless fries. Prices are pretty high for burgers. I had a Cobb salad and it only had a few pieces of avocado. French onion soup was delicous. Service was prompt and friendly.

Like all RRs, it's sticky, stinky, and loud, BUT... The kids love it. The food, for being mass produced, was actually decent. Most of s stuck to burgers but the chicken strips were good and the fry choices along with sauces were a fun surprise.

I used to eat at Red Robin frequently and have been to this one before. Most of the time I have had fairly pleasant experiences with them , this one was not so great. Restaurant was cold, it was cold outside and the wind was blowing but even with my jacket on it took some time to warm up inside. I ordered water without ice, it came with ice. My daughter ordered hot chocolate, it came lukewarm. The waitress did offer to bring her a warm one and did  bring me water without ice I think after she heard me discussing with my partner how they had messed this up. They now have electronic touchpads you can order on at the table, you can also play games on these but it cost you money. This is a big distraction when you have a young child who wants to play the games that are priced at a premium. This diminished the experience I had as my daughter was more focused on wanting to play games and not happy that she wasn't allowed to. They also keep advertising pictures of dessert, anyone with a child knows when they're flashing ice cream and root beer floats the "can I have" questions come over and over again. I ordered the guacamole burger as I had before on a number of occasions. The toppings on the burger were sparse, usually while eating a burger there it makes a bit of a mess on the plate. I guess looking for the positive here there was no mess the negative, a lot of flavor was missing. It was still an OK burger but not what I expected. My partner woke up at 3 AM with a very upset stomach after eating her normal dinner there. The floor had a bit of a dirty greasy feel to it. Parking was hard to find i'm not sure part of the lot was closed off for construction or if that was it.

Let me just start by saying that I've never been a huge Red Robin fan. There are just too many good burgers in this town to settle for a mediocre chain. But my husband, for some reason, thinks RR is terrific. We went on Christmas Eve prior to catching a movie at Clackamas Town Center. This was our first, and probably last, experience with their tabletop consoles. No thank you, we don't want to play games (for a price) while we eat dinner. Actually, we choose to engage with each other instead. We did use the "call your server" option when we were being ignored. Leah, our server, came over, turned off the device, then told us she'd be back in a few minutes. WTF?  What's the point of calling her if she's still going to ignore us?  All they're doing is reducing staffing and increasing customer frustration with this little doo-hickey. Our burgers were ok, not great, as always. Fries came out cold, and based on Leah's response, my guess is that this happens a lot. It happened the last time I was there too. From what I hear, RR is trying to increase profit on the whole bottomless fries option. I heard a server say you can no longer order a side of bottomless fries - it's a one-time serving only, even if you're ordering them to go with a salad or something.  Pass.

If you want a good hamburger and some hot French Fry's this is the place to go Friendly staff always hot and fast if the games on the table were free like at Applebee's I'd give them 5* but $1.99 for games that are on our phones is ridiculous....  The food is good but the air vent overhead dropping dust bunnies was very off putting!

We've been pretty happy with this location for consistent service and food - The new table computers are useful for paging the server and paying or splitting the check. They are easy with the dipping sauces and bun substitutions.  (i love the ciabatta for the guac bacon burger) Recently I had misplaced my wallet and the staff/management found it kept it safely locked up until I called about it couple days later.  [yeah I should have realized it sooner.] Parking is difficult so that would be point off. Compared to other locations, this one's parking access is really cramped and usually we have to find an aux lot across the street which is harder with a baby now.

Waited 20 minutes for a table which is normal. What was not expected was to be seated and no service.  Another table was seated after us next to us.  Their server waited their table right away. We watched them receive their meal, eat their meal, pay for their meal, and leave within an hour. Our table had not been waited on yet. 5 month old baby and a 8 year old to celebrate her 8th birthday. I had to go up to the hostess and ask to speak to a manager. We got our food within 10 minutes. He proceeded to take $10 off our order. Not satisfied. Disappointed. We have never had this sort of service here in the 20 years prior. Not sure if we'd return.

Where do I even begin?  How about parking. Like, the lack of it. At the time of this writing, there was construction going on with the Half-hearted Christian morals chicken place. So, even if they didn't look busy, it was just a trial trying to find a parking spot. You might was well park at Target and walk there. Service is ok. Just ok. They did refill my drink and fried expeditiously.  The food? Well, several years ago, when the place was fun, their burgers were great. Always served hot, cooked to perfection, a nice basket of fries, hot and crisp.  The burger I ordered ended up being quite tepid to pretty much cold, sloppily crafted. The fries were quite limp and cold. Cold, as if you tried microwaving frozen fries for a minute and expecting them to be hot and crisp. I did request for a new batch, but still the same, just slightly warmer.  Their "new image" really needs to be fine tuned for my family and I to return. It's quite disappointing, especially when the children love coming to the restaurant.

I will Not be going back to this place, poor service waitress was clearly more interested in flirting with my husband than talking to me, she brought me the wrong hamburger , apparently was to busy acting like a tramp to my husband to remember that I also asked for sauce for my fry's Not just my husband. Not happy!!! As for the restaurant it was very noisy even after 9pm, I my plate had some fries that were so burnt I'm not even sure it was a fry.

Burgers were good, service was terrible. No one in our party received the benefits of "bottomless" anything, despite the fact we all quickly finished our first serving of side. We were there for over an hour. We tried to call our waitress for over ten minutes using the table tablet device, but she never came and no other server arrived. We will not be going to this location again.

Well. Why do you go to a chain Consistency.  Did I get consistency. Well..., I suppose. Yes.  While the initial greeting was descent  And I usually don't ding a place on service.  I am making an exception.  One of the reasons I eat out, is not just the food, but to feel special.  To feel important. To feel treated with kindness and consideration at the and of a ( 12 hr day today) long day.  I didn't feel that.  I am 51.  I don't need flirting or inappropriately lengthy conversations.  I do require a minimum  I've never received less than the minimum until today at red robin.  One line greeting  One line responses  One line checkups.  Food what I expected, but not hot.  Sweet potato fries greasy.  And when I'm done.  You have to pay on some tablet on the table. No offer to take the bill in person.  Two extra interpersonal opportunities for red robin to make you feel special thrown away.  Tablet defaults to a 20% tip, while my usual amount, I thought it a bit high considering the lack of personal touch  I could have purchased something at the store And microwaved it in my hotel and received more human interaction.  I will not return until the tablets for paying on the counter are gone.  Make me do more work to pay, expect a high tip in exchange for less human interaction. Minimal interaction to boot.  That's the worst business decision I have ever seen.  Good luck red robin.  Your going to need it.

GOOD TIME FOR CHICK-FIL-A. Now that I just had another messed up takeout order from Red Robin, it's a great time to take my business to the new guys. Service has been declining at this Red Robin for over a year, as also observed by our other family members. Maybe competition will give them a much needed wake up call. Beware of those new table electronic gizmos as well, since there are hidden fees for using them- as we learned when we used another Red Robin. They push you to use them, knowing it means more $$ to them. Adios Red.

Food is pretty good and fairly priced. With a family of five we were able to all eat and not have to take out a loan. My sons enjoyed the bottomless root beer floats. However, the place was pretty busy so they were not able to get but one refill. The newly opened Chick-fil-a makes parking completely insane because of the drive-thru traffic. Recommend parking across the street near the Target and walking.

Oh red robin how far you have fallen.  Let me start with the food service.  2 tables were seated after us and we're able to have drinks and orders taken while we sat with water. We only had a party of 3 so it was not like we were hard to sit.  Not surprisingly the other tables also got their food before us.   Next is not only based on this visit but rather my sinking opinion of the franchise. There was a time when I would argue that it was a great deal with their bottomless fries (THAT THEY USED TO GIVE OUT STRAIGHTAWAY BUT NOT ANYMORE) and a nicely prepared burger that i think USED to be a great bargain. Also I really liked their BBQ chicken salads that are now just a splattering of iceberg with a cold piece of chicken on the side.  I've watched this over the years shrink from a well-prepared bowl of salad to an appetizer side stretched out on a rectangular plate.   Now back to my experience today.  The burger on our order looked like it might have been sitting a while and my salad did not come with dressing or the sides of Texas toast.  Not the best experience and my son who was meeting us before work had to dash out because of the tardiness of the staff.   The waitress actually felt bad because they forgot the dressing and proceeded to deliver about 4 servings too many  like that was supposed to make up for it.  You know how wait staff gets that feeling of dread when they come back to ask if there's anything else they can get you?   Kind of looks a little like embarrassment?  Well that's they way she was with us the remaining time we were there.  We could not wait to get out of there.   Wanted to try the desserts as well but could not bear another minute there.   The best part of the trip you ask?  The ability to just swipe my card at the kiosk and pay my bill without having to wait for a check to be delivered.  Needless to say I will it be back and as for the Clackamas store I might just use my time to visit the Chick-fil-A next door.  At least there I'm sure of what I'll get and I'm a timely manner.  So long red robin and you can take your rewards card(that still has a free birthday burger on it) back too.

This is by far the best Red Robin we have ever been to! If you get a chance to have Susan as your server, you will have awesome service :-) She is the best ever we have ever had!!!  Today we ordered The Burning Love hamburgers. And they were delicious!!!. We also had our fries made extra crispy with honey mustard dressing for dipping and it was yummmmmmy. If you get a chance try the jalapeno coins they're really really really good too!!  My favorite salad is the crispy chicken tender salad with honey mustard dressing
New boneless wings are awesome! Not your usual. Staff is fun and attentive.  Food came out hot and fresh. Really impressed. Don't usually do reviews for chains but they deserve this. Go there

We have been loyal customers of Red Robin for decades.  I had been feeling very sorry for Red Robin in Clackamas since the new restaraunt opened right next to it causing terrible traffic and problems getting into the parking lot.  Last night we braved the traffic into the parking lot hoping to get a reliable burger and service.  Upon entering the restaraunt their was no one at the host desk.  With a family of four in front of us we decided to seat ourselves in the bar.  I have never had such rude service in my life.  The waitress in the bar (don't remember her telling us her name) was so extremely rude from the get-go we decided to leave before we ordered and will not be returning.  Sad, this had been one of our regular haunts with friends and family but will not be returning!

I rarely write restaurant reviews but just had to. I've been to Red Robin a zillion times. It's never been my favorite but just that nearby go to restaurant for a burger that I've always ended up eating at. But last weekend we stopped in and this visit definitely deserved a review. First off the traffic just to park in the lot is ridiculous due to chick fil a (not a big deal park across the street and walk but still a hassle). Second the wait time was 30 minutes for two and a toddler yet once we were seated there were a ton of open (dirty but available) tables. The bench seat near the window where I was supposed to sit was covered in crumbs and ketchup. Ten minutes went by and still no waiter just to take a drink order even. At this point we had already spent a total of 40 minutes in Red Robin. They offer computer tablets at each table and you can press the call button for a server which flashes a red light but still no one came rushing over. Finally a waiter yay. Took our order and when we were nearly finished eating was the only other time we saw him again. Someone else brought our food and we never did get a check. I guess everyone is just expected to uSe the computer at the table. The food was nothing special yet expensive for the quality, poor service, and dirty tables. Yuck. Better off at McDonald's.
This place has went to shit! Cold fries and Luke warm burgers that are tiny. Won't be back!

What happened to their service? Just because they bought iPads to the table does not mean they should cut down their servers! The service is extremely slow...   UPDATE: it took 20 mins to salads, but the server did not give us forks!! Waited for another 5 mins for a waiter to come by and was frustrated so I just grabbed them myself .

Ugh. Really?! I picked up an order to go on a Friday night. The new fast food restaurant that shares a parking lot means mayhem & a 10 minute wait just to get in to the parking lot. The gal that gave me my order was super nice, which saved them from a single star. My BLTA croissant was just this side of disgusting. Soggy greasy bread, two tiny pieces of limp bacon, a slab of highly processed "turkey", a pile of shredded iceberg, a blackening leaf of dry dirty lettuce, tomato (the highlight at average) and nary a smidge of avocado to be found. Alongside a pile of greasy potatoes. Never again Red Robin. Yuck.

This is truly the best chain restaurant experience my husband and I have ever had, together and with friends.  This Red Robin is consistently fast and has always accurate; and they alllwwaaayyysss keep us stocked on french fries. Of all of the Red Robins we've been to in Oregon and California, this one is by far the best.

I stop in about once a year since I was a kid, and slowly I have watched it go downhill. The floors are disgusting. Wrong orders. Tables piled with dirty dishes. Poor waiter trying to do 5 people's jobs. Hair in food. I could go on you get the point. But man are the strawberry lemonades good!

Great place! Our server was Jennifer H and she was wonderful, very friendly and attentive. I am a server myself and I love giving appreciation to exceptional service. The food came out fast and was delicious! Burgers were cooked exactly how we wanted them, and Jennifer always made sure we had fries and drinks. I had never been to a Red Robin before, and my husband and I had such a great time today we will definitely be back often!!

This Red Robin had clean tables, and the food was as good as any other time we've been here. The waitress was great about my gluten intolerance. As is typical, when you get water, they disappear. I wish waitresses would understand refilling my water is just as important as the other guys soda. For some reason, the hostess sat us at the booth right by the bathroom. It was a bit busy, but I saw other booths open, and can't figure why they seated us in the least desirable spot. I think I'm going to have to speak up the next time, when this has now happened the last two times in a row. This location is just like any other Red Robin in setup and pricing. Nothing new. Nothing different. Just affordable (tavern burgers only), good food.

I've been going to red robins for many many years now. But it seems like every single time I go to the Clackamas location I get the worst service in the world. The service take forever on the food. They never come back and ask us if we need anything. Every time I tell them I want extra fries takes about 20 minutes to get my fries. Every time I asked for extra dipping sauce they never come back until I get the check. Red robins used to have extremely good service I don't know what happened. Either the management is falling apart or either the employees are falling apart but something needs to be done ASAP otherwise red robins will go under. I will bring my family here for many years and hopefully I can come back again soon but I will not be coming here and bring in my business.

Sitting here and just past the 2 hour mark. If I wasn't here for a birthday I would have left. Pretty unfortunate for the birthday girl. Would not recommend this place to anyone at this point and sadly I can't rate the food

There are so many staff members here-not sure about the uniforms or lack of.  Almost zero self respect with the way the staff is dressed.  Anything black off the floor seems to qualify as a uniform.   The floors are slippery with oil, the floors need to be swept badly.  Everything is a 10 -15 min wait-OPEN tables everywhere.  It's so strange, most likely will not be back.

The strawberry lemonade was adequate...The whiskey bbq chicken burger was good... The garlic fries were awesome! The service however was a bit lacking.  I asked for no onion straws on burger and there they were... Luckily they are easy to remove. A co-worker didn't get his honey mustard to dip them fries. Asked for fries to brought out first and that didn't happen! The chairs were bright red and funky, but nice... The atmosphere was typical for Red Robin, which is crowded and a bit on the noisy side. One thing to also remember about this Red Robin is that because of the Chick-fil-a the parking lot can be a nightmare to enter and to leave since the drive thru cuts right thru the entrance and exit. Overall, it was okay... Not the best, but I don't expect that out of Red Robin anymore... and I can't also complain too much since my boss took care of the check!

Food is typical Red Robin food. Not amazing but not terrible.  They have recently gotten rid of the ONE thing that has always been the biggest draw: being able to sit down & order fries straight away. Been going for years & have always done that. When we asked for fries to start, our server Kennedy was condescending & extremely rude. She remained unhelpful & straight up bitchy the entire time we were there. I'm sure we weren't the first nor the last customers who were slightly dismayed at the sudden change so I'm extremely confused where her lack of customer service came from. Because of Kenedy's beyond terrible customer service, I'm sure we aren't the only people who will not be going back to this particular location.

Worst service ever. Been sitting here for 15 minutes so far. That's right I'm reviewing as I wait. Can't eat my dinner without a beverage. Fries gone quite some time ago. Won't be back. Red keeps innovating with their menu - most hamburger joints put out a fairly standard fare of options and that's it.  Sort of like going to McDonalds and getting either Chocolate or Vanilla Ice Cream or going to Baskin Robins for 31 flavors.  The Chocolate or Vanilla options are going to be less expensive, but seriously, if you can afford it, wouldn't you want to explore many of those other choices? The staff work as a team - your food is brought out as soon as it comes up - either by your server or someone else.  The ingredients are top notch and who can complain about bottomless fries?  (Perhaps a sad choice because anyone who would take advantage of this is certainly far from bottomless). I had the chili-chili burger, served open face.  To me, "open face" that should have translated in to "wow - there's so much chili on the burger that the bun just can not contain it all".  Sadly the cook at Red translates that to "put the smallest amount of chili possible on top of the center of the burger and show it off by leaving the top of the bun off to the side". The wife went for the soup and a wrap.  The combination of french onion soup with a chicken wrap was a great combination for her. We will keep going back - it's more expensive than I would like, but the setting is nice enough, the adult beverage selection is wide enough that it is clearly the "Baskin Robbins" of burgers and not McDonald's.  You just gotta expect to have to pay for that.

Fern bars  and  coupons The term "fern bar" probably originated when men sported mustaches and women worked hard on their feathered hair.  I still find it funny.  And I still use it.  A "fern bar" was basically a low- to mid-priced (chain) eatery featuring burgers, sandwiches, and libations which was decked out in downmarket wood paneling, brass railing, and, you guessed it, greenery such as ferns.  They could also double as pick up places. Having lived in North Clackamas County for quite a while, I knew of the Clackamas Red Robin but never went there.  I had been to a Red Robin once before.  It was probably in the Southeastern U.S. somewhere.  My opinion of the chain was neither negative or positive.   Well, a red coupon arrived and it knocked off $4 off of a meal costing $10 or more.  I decided to go to the nearby Red Robin, south of and across from Clackamas Town Center and sharing the parking lot with Chick-fil-A.  After all, I needed dinner.  That coupon expires tomorrow, March 5th. A person walks in, sees the hosting stand, and has multiple choice when it comes to where they might sit.  From left to right, there is a more dim seating area with booths, a brighter and bigger seating area with a taller ceiling, an area of booths raised up in true "fern bar" fashion sort of behind the bar, and then the bar with its stools and eating area fronting the greenhouse type windows.  I ate in the bigger dining room. There is a lot to choose from and they present burgers many different ways.  There are also chicken burgers, entrees, some Mexican staples, appetizers, and a boatload of cocktails. I had a turkey burger.  I had them add sauteed mushrooms.  The platter came with steak fries.  And one can have more of these steak fries upon requesting them.  I thought that was sort of cool.  Truth be told, the turkey burger was very good.  The fries were good, and it was even better that I could enjoy a second batch of them.  There were some interesting lemonades being served but, being winter(y), I stuck to a cup of coffee. The service was very amicable and expedient.  The server kept checking in on me.  The prices are fair and, if one sticks to an entree and a non-alcoholic drink, the tab is reasonable.  It's when people go bonkers on appetizers, desserts, and booze that the tab climbs ... but that's true anywhere.   Well, Red Robin is still a "fern bar."  It's also a sports bar.  And I also discovered it appears to be a date night sort of place for younger Clackamettes and Clackameisters.  Good God, especially to the latter.  And I'm going to be nicer than most of the reviewers.  Do I give it a 4 for F-E-R-N?  Or do I give it a 3 for B-A-R?  Even if I averaged the two, the 3.5 would round up to 4 stars.  For its genre, what can you expect?  It's true to form.  I'm o.k. with 4 stars for Red Robin - Clackamas.

We have a tradition in the Singer Family: if a doctor's visit includes any sort of needle, we go out to eat afterwards. Our pediatrician's office is not too far from this location, and lo and behold! It was booster shot time for our youngest daughter, Turtledove. When the Male Unit and I asked what she was in the mood for, the reply was, "Steamed broccoli!" And so, we headed for the nearby Red Robin. We've been to other Red Robins before, as Turtledove and our goddaughter, Ladybug, enjoy going there after seeing shows or movies. They tend to be pretty noisy. I'm legally deaf, and it would still be far too loud for me. Thankfully, this was not the case at the Clackamas location.  The hostess saw me coming in with my cane, and was quick to ask me where I'd be most comfortable in a sincere and polite manner. She even offered to let us change tables if it wasn't working out for me, which I appreciated. The food was good, and I particularly enjoyed the strawberry lemonade. It's also nice to order some broccoli for Turtledove and not have the server try to convince you to smother it in cheese! I had the Clucks & Fries, which are particularly nice with the honey mustard dipping sauce. The Male Unit had some sort of mushroom burger, and reported it was a perfect medium.  Easily the best part of the experience was our server, Noelle. As my husband is also in the service industry (and I used to be), and there were few other customers at the time, we had a nice chat with her about the many pros and cons of the business in Portland (particularly how the now-widespread use of electronic ordering/game tablets on the tables are loved by some customers and loathed by others).  But what I appreciated most was how she interacted with our daughter. Following the immunization, she was less like her usual, chipper Turtledove self and more like her rarely-seen alter-ego, Snapping Turtle. But Noelle had her smiling and laughing in no time!  The next time Turtledove & Ladybug want some Red Robin, we'll return to this location. Same food, less headaches! FINAL TALLY:    1 star for the food    1 star for the accessibility     1 star for the quieter atmosphere      1 star for the service  NOTE: I am not including an accessibility report on the bathroom facilities, as I did not utilize them on this visit.
